protocol_name: HA tag enables highly efficient detection of heterologous proteins in Phaeodactylum tricornutum (Pt) exconjugants
protocol_name_html: HA tag enables highly efficient detection of heterologous proteins in Phaeodactylum tricornutum (Pt) exconjugants
description: Invitrogen's HA tag monoclonal antibody in combination with Western Breeze Anti-Mouse Chemiluminescent Western Blot Immunodetection Kit leads to no background Western blots with Pt lysates. HA tag thus represents a tag of choice for (1) efficient and unambioguous protein expression analysis, (2) immunofluorescence experiments and (3) various IP and pull-down experiments in Pt and possibly other diatoms as well as other marine microeukaryotes.
before_start: The starting point of this protocol is a genotype+ genetically engineered Pt strain.
protocol_affiliation: Harvard Medical School, Department of Systems Biology | UC San Diego, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO) | J. Craig Venter Institute (JCVI)
affiliation: Harvard Medical School, Department of Systems Biology | UC San Diego, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO) | J. Craig Venter Institute (JCVI)

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

authors_list.name: Jernej Turnsek
authors_list.affiliation: Harvard Medical School, Department of Systems Biology | UC San Diego, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO) | J. Craig Venter Institute (JCVI)

guidelines: Recommended HA tag nucleotide sequence is as follows: 5'-TATCCGTATGATGTCCCCGATTACGCG-3'.

components.data: Cell lysis
components.name: Section

components.data: Spin down ~107-108 Pt cells for 10 min at 4000 rpm & 10 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin down ~107-108 Pt cells for 10 min at 4000 rpm & 10 °C.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of HA tag enables highly efficient detection of heterologous proteins in Phaeodactylum tricornutum (Pt)
source_data.protocol_name: HA tag enables highly efficient detection of heterologous proteins in Phaeodactylum tricornutum (Pt) exconjugants

source_data.annotation: Keep tubes on ice throughout the protocol.
source_data.thread_text: Keep tubes on ice throughout the protocol.
source_data.body: Keep tubes on ice throughout the protocol.
source_data.affiliation: Harvard Medical School, Department of Systems Biology | UC San Diego, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO) | J. Craig Venter Institute (JCVI)

components.data: Resuspend pellets in 50-200 μL cell lysis buffer: 50 mM Tris-HCl, 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM DTT, 1 mM PMSF.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend pellets in 50-200 μL cell lysis buffer: 50 mM Tris-HCl, 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM DTT, 1 mM PMSF.

components.data: Sonicate as follows: 30 sec on / 1 min off for 15 min. We use Bioruptor UCD-200TM.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Sonicate as follows: 30 sec on / 1 min off for 15 min. We use Bioruptor UCD-200TM.

components.data: Quantify total protein content in supernatants
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Quantify total protein content in supernatants

components.data: Use your favorite protein quantification assay. We use ThermoFischer's Bradford assay.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use your favorite protein quantification assay. We use ThermoFischer's Bradford assay.

components.data: Separate supernatants and pellets/insoluble fractions by centrifuging lysates 45 min at 13500 rpm & 10 °C. Resuspend pellets/insoluble fractions in 100 μL lysis buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Separate supernatants and pellets/insoluble fractions by centrifuging lysates 45 min at 13500 rpm & 10 °C. Resuspend pellets/insoluble fractions in 100 μL lysis buffer.

components.data: Load 10 μL supernatant sample (10 μg protein) and 10 μL pellet/insoluble fraction sample (1 μL "stock"). Load also 6 μL MagicMark protein standard.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Load 10 μL supernatant sample (10 μg protein) and 10 μL pellet/insoluble fraction sample (1 μL "stock"). Load also 6 μL MagicMark protein standard.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 6 of HA tag enables highly efficient detection of heterologous protein expression in Phaeodactylum tricornutum (Pt) exconjugants
source_data.protocol_name: HA tag enables highly efficient detection of heterologous proteins in Phaeodactylum tricornutum (Pt) exconjugants
source_data.protocol_name_html: HA tag enables highly efficient detection of heterologous proteins in Phaeodactylum tricornutum (Pt) exconjugants
source_data.annotation:
1. Prepare MOPS running buffer as follows: 665 mL MQ + 35 mL 20x MOPS buffer.

2. We have had good experience with NuPage 4-12% Bis-Tris 1.5 mm gels with 10 wells. 

3. Add 500 μL NuPAGE Antioxidant to the inner reservoir.
source_data.thread_text:
1. Prepare MOPS running buffer as follows: 665 mL MQ + 35 mL 20x MOPS buffer.

2. We have had good experience with NuPage 4-12% Bis-Tris 1.5 mm gels with 10 wells. 

3. Add 500 μL NuPAGE Antioxidant to the inner reservoir.
source_data.body:
1. Prepare MOPS running buffer as follows: 665 mL MQ + 35 mL 20x MOPS buffer.

2. We have had good experience with NuPage 4-12% Bis-Tris 1.5 mm gels with 10 wells. 

3. Add 500 μL NuPAGE Antioxidant to the inner reservoir.
source_data.affiliation: Harvard Medical School, Department of Systems Biology | UC San Diego, Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO) | J. Craig Venter Institute (JCVI)

components.data: Separate proteins for 50 min at 200 V.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Separate proteins for 50 min at 200 V.

components.data: Protein transfer
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare transfer buffer: 40 mL NuPage Transfer Buffer (20x), 160 mL methanol, 600 mL MQ, 800 μL NuPAGE Antioxidant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare transfer buffer: 40 mL NuPage Transfer Buffer (20x), 160 mL methanol, 600 mL MQ, 800 μL NuPAGE Antioxidant.

source_data.annotation: We do a wet transfer using XCell IITM Blot Module and PVDF membranes.
source_data.thread_text: We do a wet transfer using XCell IITM Blot Module and PVDF membranes.
source_data.body: We do a wet transfer using XCell IITM Blot Module and PVDF membranes.

components.data: Running SDS-PAGE
components.name: Section

components.data:
Prepare supernatants as follows (40 μL total): 10 μL NuPage LDS Sample Buffer (4x), 4 μL NuPAGE Sample Reducing Agent (10x), 40 μg protein, MQ.

Prepare pellets/insoluble fractions as follows (40 uL total): 10 μL NuPage LDS Sample Buffer (4x), 4 μL NuPAGE Sample Reducing Agent (10x), 4 μL pellet/insoluble fraction suspension, 22 μL MQ.  

 

Incubate at 70 °C for 15 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare supernatants as follows (40 μL total): 10 μL NuPage LDS Sample Buffer (4x), 4 μL NuPAGE Sample Reducing Agent (10x), 40 μg protein, MQ.

Prepare pellets/insoluble fractions as follows (40 uL total): 10 μL NuPage LDS Sample Buffer (4x), 4 μL NuPAGE Sample Reducing Agent (10x), 4 μL pellet/insoluble fraction suspension, 22 μL MQ.  

 

Incubate at 70 °C for 15 min.

components.data: Soak ~7 pads in transfer buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Soak ~7 pads in transfer buffer.

components.data: Activate PVDF membranes in methanol (~1 min is good). Wash in MQ, leave in transfer buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Activate PVDF membranes in methanol (~1 min is good). Wash in MQ, leave in transfer buffer.

components.data: Blocking
components.name: Section

components.data: Cut top right corner of each membrane to track membrane faces containing proteins.

source_data.description: Cut top right corner of each membrane to track membrane faces containing proteins.

components.data: Wash each membrane twice with 20 mL MQ for 5 min.

components.data: Prapare blocking buffer. For 2 membranes: 10 mL MQ, 4 mL "Part A", 6 mL "Part B".
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prapare blocking buffer. For 2 membranes: 10 mL MQ, 4 mL "Part A", 6 mL "Part B".

components.data: Block at least 1 h at room temperature. Use 10 mL/membrane.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Block at least 1 h at room temperature. Use 10 mL/membrane.

components.data: Wash each membrane twice with 20 mL MQ for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash each membrane twice with 20 mL MQ for 5 min.

components.data: Incubation in primary antibodies
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare 1:10000 dilution of HA tag monoclonal antibody: 14 mL MQ, 4 mL "Part A", 2 mL "Part B", 2 µL antibody stock.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare 1:10000 dilution of HA tag monoclonal antibody: 14 mL MQ, 4 mL "Part A", 2 mL "Part B", 2 µL antibody stock.

components.data: Use 10 mL antibody solution per membrane and incubate ~3 hr.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use 10 mL antibody solution per membrane and incubate ~3 hr.

components.data: Prepare 160 mL wash solution: 150 mL MQ + 10 mL Wash Solution (16x). Wash each membrane 4 times in 20 mL for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare 160 mL wash solution: 150 mL MQ + 10 mL Wash Solution (16x). Wash each membrane 4 times in 20 mL for 5 min.

components.data: Incubation in secondary antibodies
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate each membrane in 10 mL anti-mouse secondary antibody solution for 1 hr.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate each membrane in 10 mL anti-mouse secondary antibody solution for 1 hr.

components.data: Prepare 160 mL wash solution: 150 mL MQ + 10 mL Wash Solution (16x). Wash each membrane 4 times in 20 mL for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare 160 mL wash solution: 150 mL MQ + 10 mL Wash Solution (16x). Wash each membrane 4 times in 20 mL for 5 min.

components.data: Wash each membrane 3 times in 20 mL MQ for 2 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash each membrane 3 times in 20 mL MQ for 2 min.

components.data: Chemiluminescent detection
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove excess liquid, place a membrane on transparent plastic foil and cover it evenly with 2 mL Novex CDP-Star alkaline phosphatase substrate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove excess liquid, place a membrane on transparent plastic foil and cover it evenly with 2 mL Novex CDP-Star alkaline phosphatase substrate.

components.data: Cover with alufoil and incubate ~5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cover with alufoil and incubate ~5 min.

components.data: Remove excess liquid and cover with another transparent plastic sheet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove excess liquid and cover with another transparent plastic sheet.

components.name: Section

components.data: We use LI-COR's C-DiGit Blot Scanner.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We use LI-COR's C-DiGit Blot Scanner.

components.data: Expected result
components.name: Section

components.data: 5 genotype+ Pt exconjugants were screened for protein-HA expression. The left and right image below were obtained with superntants and insoluble fractions, respectively.
components.name: Description
